content:
Slideshow: Selected Photos From the Liljenquist Family Collection Young Girl in Mourning   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_girl-in-mourning-dress.jpg.jpg Unidentified girl in a mourning dress holding a framed photograph of her cavalryman father. Nearly 620,000 soldiers died during the war, almost 2 percent of the entire population of the United States at the time. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Private Albert H. Davis   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_pvt-albert-davis-of-company-k.jpg.jpg Private Albert H. Davis of Company K, 6th New Hampshire Infantry Regiment in uniform, shoulder scales and Hardee hat with Model 1841 Mississippi rifle, sword bayonet, knapsack with bedroll, canteen and haversack. Civil War soldiers carried between 30 and 40 pounds of supplies on their backs. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Boy with 34-star Flag   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_boy-holding-34-star-flag.jpg.jpg Unidentified boy holding a 34-star flag, which became the flag of the United States on July 4, 1861, following the admission of Kansas to the Union. It was used until the newly created West Virginia joined the Union in 1863. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la African American Soldier and Family   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-african-american-with-wife-and-daughters.jpg.jpg Unidentified African American soldier in a Union uniform with his wife and two daughters. Some 180,000 African Americans fought in the war, almost exclusively for the Union. Nearly 40,000 of them died. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la African American Union Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-african-american-with-rifle-and-revolver.jpg.jpg Unidentified African American Union soldier with a rifle and revolver in front of a painted backdrop showing weapons and an American flag at Benton Barracks, St. Louis, Missouri. African Americans constituted less than 1 percent of the northern population but 10 percent of the Union Army. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Young Union Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_young-union-soldier-with-forage-cap.jpg.jpg Unidentified young soldier in a Union uniform and forage cap. More than 10,000 Union soldiers were under the age of 18. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Young Union Sailor   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_young-sailor-with-american-flag.jpg.jpg Unidentified young sailor in uniform with an American flag in front of a naval scene backdrop. The minimum age to join the Union Navy was 13; it was 14 for the Confederate Navy. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldier with Fife   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldier-with-fife.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Union uniform with a fife in front of a painted backdrop showing a pastoral landscape. The Civil War was the last conflict in which military bands played on the battlefield. There were more than 400 Union bands and 125 Confederate bands. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldier with Model 1855 Pistol   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldier-with-pistol-and-saber.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Union uniform holding a U.S. Model 1855 pistol-carbine, the last single-shot pistol produced as an issue arm for U.S. troops. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Girl with Flag and Ball   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_girl-in-dress-holding-american-flag-and-ball.jpg.jpg Unidentified girl holding an American flag and ball. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Private John Ryan   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_pvt-john-ryan-of-company-h.jpg.jpg Private John Ryan of Company H, 2nd Rhode Island Infantry Regiment. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la First Scotch Regiment Member   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_soldier-of-12th-illinois-volunteers.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier of the 12th Illinois Volunteers, known as the First Scotch Regiment, wearing a greatcoat and tamoshanter cap. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la African American Sergeant   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-african-american-holding-rifle.jpg.jpg Unidentified African American soldier in a Union sergeant uniform holding a rifle. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Three Union Soldiers   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_three-union-soldiers.jpg.jpg Three unidentified soldiers in Union uniforms. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la African American Union Sailor   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-african-american-sailor.jpg.jpg Unidentified African American sailor in a Union uniform. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldier-holding-revolver-and-american-flag.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Union artillery uniform with a revolver and American flag. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldier with Child   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldier-holding-young-child.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in Union uniform holding a young child in his lap. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la African American Union Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-african-american-wearing-artillery-shell-jacket.jpg.jpg Unidentified African American soldier in a Union artillery shell jacket and shoulder scales in front of a painted backdrop showing a military camp. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldier with Musket   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldier-with-musket.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Union uniform with a musket. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldier with Woman   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldier-with-woman-in-dress.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Union uniform with an unidentified woman. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Union Soldiers with Cigars   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_union-soldiers-holding-cigars.jpg.jpg Two unidentified soldiers in Union uniforms holding cigars in each other's mouths. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Women of War   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_two-women-wearing-printed-dresses.jpg.jpg Two unidentified young women wearing printed dresses and necklaces in front of a painted backdrop showing a plantation. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Woman with Mourning Brooch   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_woman-wearing-mourning-brooch.jpg.jpg Unidentified woman wearing a mourning brooch and displaying a framed image of an unidentified soldier. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Young Confederate Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_confederate-soldier-holding-book.jpg.jpg Unidentified young soldier in a Confederate uniform holding a book. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Confederate Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_confederate-soldier-wearing-artillery-jacket.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Confederate artillery jacket with a secession badge and artillery forage hat. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Confederate Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_confederate-soldier-wearing-captain-coat-and-hat.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Confederate captain's frock coat and hat. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la Confederate Soldier   http://www.history.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/civil-war_confederate-soldier-of-company-e.jpg.jpg Unidentified soldier in a Confederate uniform of Co. E, "Lynchburg Rifles," 11th Virginia Infantry Volunteers, holding a 1841 "Mississippi" rifle, Sheffield-type Bowie knife, canteen, box knapsack, blanket roll and cartridge box. (Photo Credit: Library of Congress) la jQuery.noConflict(); tid('sgpro_slideshow').style.display = "none"; tid('slideshow-wrapper').style.display = 'block'; tid('slideshow-wrapper').style.visibility = 'hidden'; /** * issue #2: Bugfix for WebKit. Safari and similar browsers aren't capable to handle jQuery.ready() right. The problem * here was, that sometimes the event was fired (if js is not available in browsers cache) too early, so that not all * pictures were displayed in the thumbnail bar. I added a timeout to give the browser time to load the pictures. * During that time I found it nice to display a spinner icon to give the visitor a hint that "somethings going on there". * For this to display correctly I've added some lines to the css file too. */ // append the spinner jQuery("#fullsize").append('
'); tid('spinner').style.visibility = 'visible'; var sgpro_slideshow = new TINY.sgpro_slideshow("sgpro_slideshow"); jQuery(document).ready(function() { // set a timeout before launching the sgpro_slideshow window.setTimeout(function() { sgpro_slideshow.auto = false; sgpro_slideshow.linker = "true"; sgpro_slideshow.nolinkpage = "false"; sgpro_slideshow.pagelink="self"; sgpro_slideshow.speed = 10; sgpro_slideshow.imgSpeed = 10; sgpro_slideshow.navOpacity = 25; sgpro_slideshow.navHover = 70; sgpro_slideshow.letterbox = "#000000"; sgpro_slideshow.info = "information"; sgpro_slideshow.infoSpeed = 10; sgpro_slideshow.left = "slideleft"; sgpro_slideshow.right = "slideright"; sgpro_slideshow.link = "linkhover"; sgpro_slideshow.thumbs = "thumbslider"; sgpro_slideshow.thumbOpacity = 70; // sgpro_slideshow.scrollSpeed = 5; sgpro_slideshow.scrollSpeed = 5; sgpro_slideshow.spacing = 5; sgpro_slideshow.active = "#FFFFFF"; sgpro_slideshow.imagesbox = "thickbox"; jQuery("#spinner").remove(); sgpro_slideshow.init("sgpro_slideshow","image","imgprev","imgnext","imglink"); tid('slideshow-wrapper').style.visibility = 'visible'; }, 1000); });
title: Civil War Photos Go on Display at the Library of Congress
author: History.com  Staff
